votebox.middle.view

Class ViewManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • votebox.middle.view.ViewManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IViewManager

    public class ViewManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IViewManager
    The ViewManager is our top level view encapsulation. Here, all top level view initialization and event response behavior is defined. The view manager (both directly and through its supporting classes) talks to (and controls) an abstract view implementation that conforms to IView.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ViewManager

        public ViewManager(IAdapter adapter,
           IBallotLookupAdapter lookupAdapter,
           IBallotVars vars,
           IViewFactory factory)
        This is the public constructor for View Manager.
        Parameters:
        adapter - This is the adapter that this view manager will use to communicate with the ballot.
        vars - These are global variables which contain important path information.
        lookupAdapter - Adapter used to fetch the state of the ballot.
        factory - Factory used to create the View to display the ballot. AView

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method essentially launches the UI system in the voting machine. Conceptually, after this call, control diverges into two threads -- one handles responding to events which land in the event queues, and one is given to the view to use.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Call this method to kill the view manager's components.

        Parameters:

        previous -

      • switchFocus

        private void switchFocus(IFocusable dt)
        Switch the focus to a given drawable. This method performs checks to ensure that the given drawable is valid before doing anything with it.
        Parameters:
        dt - Switch to this RenderCardElement.

      • invalidateAll

        private void invalidateAll()
        Ask the view to invalidate all the currently displayed buttons.

      • select

        public void select(IDrawable element)
        This method is called when the voter selects a specific candidate in a race or selects a navigation control. This method defines the response of the view to report that an actual vote has been recorded, or that the visual ballot representation has been changed.
        Parameters:
        element - This is the element which has been selected

      • select

        public void select()
        This method is called when the voter uses a hardware key to Select a specific candidate in a race or a navigation control. Here, the currently focused ADrawable is assumed to be the element that the user intends to Select.

      • focus

        public void focus(IDrawable ce)
        This method is called when the voter focuses on a specific candidate in a race. This method usually is called when something is moused over.
        Parameters:
        ce - This is the drawable which has been focused on.

      • castCommittedBallot

        public void castCommittedBallot()
        This method is called when the voter indicates that he would like to cast his ballot. This behavior can also be defined in the ViewManager as a special case of the select(...) method. We include an explicit method for the notion of ballot casting so that separate hardware can be used to convey the notion of a voter being done.
        XXX: Making the cast ballot an event is potentially unsafe design. When releasing, remove the event and put all code in this function, so that an outside party cannot register malicious code.
        Specified by:
        castCommittedBallot in interface IViewManager

      • registerForCastBallot

        public void registerForCastBallot(java.util.Observer obs)
        Allows an observer to register for the Cast Ballot event. This way, different entry points (such as the standalone version versus the auditorium implementation) can do different things with the cast ballot.
        Parameters:
        obs - This is the observer that gets registered

      • commitBallot

        public void commitBallot()
        Call this method if the voter has proceeded past the review screen.
        Specified by:
        commitBallot in interface IViewManager

      • registerForCommit

        public void registerForCommit(java.util.Observer observer)
        Register for the even that gets fired when the voter has passed the review screen. There should be behavior registered which commits the ballot to the network.
        Parameters:
        observer - Register this observer for the commit event.

      • overrideCancel

        public int overrideCancel()
                   throws IncorrectTypeException
        Looks up the override cancel page, and goes to it. The page that the voter was previously on is returned, so that if the override is denied, the caller can go back to that page.
        Throws:
        IncorrectTypeException

      • overrideCast

        public int overrideCast()
                 throws IncorrectTypeException
        Looks up the override cast page, and goes to it. The page that the voter was previously on is returned, so that if the override is denied, the caller can go back to that page.
        Throws:
        IncorrectTypeException

      • kill

        public void kill()
        This method is called when the view needs to be killed. This usually happens as a result of a Kill event.

      • moveFocusLeft

        public void moveFocusLeft()
        This method is called when the voter presses the left arrow key (or equivalent hardware) on the machine. This method is called when the user has indicated that he would like to Focus the item directly to the left of the one which is currently focused.

      • moveFocusRight

        public void moveFocusRight()
        This method is called when the voter presses the right arrow key (or equivalent hardware) on the machine. This method is called when the user has indicated that he would like to Focus the item directly to the right of the one which is currently focused.

      • moveFocusUp

        public void moveFocusUp()
        This method is called when the voter presses the up arrow key (or equivalent hardware) on the machine. This method is called when the user has indicated that he would like to Focus the item directly above the one that is currently focused.

      • moveFocusDown

        public void moveFocusDown()
        This method is called when the voter presses the down arrow key (or equivalent hardware) on the machine. This method is called when the user has indicated that he would like to Focus the item directly below the one which is currently focused.

      • moveFocusNext

        public void moveFocusNext()
        This method is called when the voter, using a voting machine with only two buttons, presses the forward arrow key (or equivalent hardware) on the machine. This method is called when the user has indicated that he would like to Focus the item directly after the one which is currently focused.

      • moveFocusBack

        public void moveFocusBack()
        This method is called when the voter, using a voting machine with only two buttons, presses the backwards arrow key (or equivalent hardware) on the machine. This method is called when the user has indicated that he would like to Focus the item directly before the one which is currently focused.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        This is the getter method for the media size. Implementers of IView must check this value to determine which size index to hand to a drawable when the IView asks it for a representative image.
        Specified by:
        getSize in interface IViewManager
        Returns:
        This method returns the currently set media size index.

      • getLanguage

        public java.lang.String getLanguage()
        This is the getter method for the language. Implementers of IView must check this value to determine which language value to hand to a drawable when the IView asks it for a representative image.
        Specified by:
        getLanguage in interface IViewManager
        Returns:
        This method returns the currently set language value.

      • getSupportedLanguages

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSupportedLanguages()
        This is the getter method for _supportedLanguages
        Returns:

      • select

        public boolean select(java.lang.String uid)
               throws UnknownUIDException,
                      SelectionException
        Call this method to explicitly make one of the toggle buttons that is currently in the layout selected. This method is implemented with a best-effort approach. This method is most notably used by a straight-ticket card strategy. Straight-ticket behavior can be though of as a macro for physically navigating through every page and selecting members of a given party. This method is precisely how that is done.
        Parameters:
        uid - This is the uid of the element that wants to be selected.
        Returns:
        If the element given is not a toggle button or doesn't exist, this method will return false. Otherwise, this method will return true.
        Throws:
        UnknownUIDException
        SelectionException

      • deselect

        public boolean deselect(java.lang.String uid,
               boolean playSound)
                 throws UnknownUIDException,
                        DeselectionException
        Call this method to explicitly make one of the toggle buttons that is currently in the layout be deselected. This method is implemented with a best-effort approach.
        Parameters:
        uid - This is the uid of the element that wants to be deselected.
        playSound -
        Returns:
        If the element does not exist or is not a toggle button, this method returns false. Otherwise, this method returns true.
        Throws:
        UnknownUIDException
        DeselectionException

      • setInitialFocus

        private void setInitialFocus(boolean previous)
        This method takes the first IFocusable in the current page and sets it to focused. This is useful as a focus initialization method: with every new page that is displayed, there should be an initial element that is focused from which the voter can move. This method takes care of the job of focusing that one initial element.
        Parameters:
        previous - a boolean denoting whether or not we have selected next or previous to get to this page

      • makePages

        private void makePages()
        Call this method to construct a list of drawable pages which are representative of the current ballot. This list will be assigned to the pages field.

      • registerQueues

        private void registerQueues()
        Call this method to tell the view where to put input events when they come up.

      • setMediaSizes

        private void setMediaSizes()
        Call this method to set the media size fields for this view manager based on properties that are defined in the ballot.

      • setLanguages

        private void setLanguages()
        Call this method to figure which languages are allowed. These should be declared in the ballot's properties.

      • registerForReview

        public void registerForReview(java.util.Observer reviewScreenObserver)
        Regsters an observer for when a review screen is encountered.
        Parameters:
        reviewScreenObserver - - observer to register
